title: What is a Knowledge Graph?
text: A Knowledge Graph is a network of connected nodes: nodes are concepts, and links show how concepts relate.
visual: <svg viewBox="0 0 200 120"><defs><filter id="shadow" x="-20%" y="-20%" width="140%" height="140%"><feDropShadow dx="1" dy="2" stdDeviation="1" flood-color="#000" flood-opacity="0.15"/></filter></defs><g transform="translate(100,50)"><line x1="0" y1="0" x2="-60" y2="-30" stroke="#ccc" stroke-width="1.5"/><line x1="0" y1="0" x2="60" y2="-30" stroke="#ccc" stroke-width="1.5"/><line x1="0" y1="0" x2="0" y2="50" stroke="#ccc" stroke-width="1.5"/><circle cx="0" cy="0" r="18" fill="#3f88c5" stroke="white" stroke-width="1" filter="url(#shadow)"/><circle cx="-60" cy="-30" r="12" fill="#F49D37" stroke="white" stroke-width="1" filter="url(#shadow)"/><circle cx="60" cy="-30" r="12" fill="#00cc66" stroke="white" stroke-width="1" filter="url(#shadow)"/><circle cx="0" cy="50" r="12" fill="#db3a34" stroke="white" stroke-width="1" filter="url(#shadow)"/></g></svg>

title: The Heart of the Discussion
text: The central node is the MAIN SUBJECT: the core topic the debate revolves around. All positions and arguments connect back to it.
visual: <svg viewBox="0 0 200 120"><g transform="translate(100,60)"><circle cx="-50" cy="-30" r="8" fill="#eee" /><circle cx="50" cy="-30" r="8" fill="#eee" /><line x1="-20" y1="-10" x2="-42" y2="-25" stroke="#eee" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="20" y1="-10" x2="42" y2="-25" stroke="#eee" stroke-width="2"/><circle cx="0" cy="0" r="25" fill="#3f88c5" stroke="#2a5c8a" stroke-width="3" filter="url(#shadow)"><animate attributeName="r" values="25;28;25" dur="2s" repeatCount="indefinite" /></circle></g></svg>

title: The Positions
text: Positions are the main viewpoints users take in response to the main subject. Each position becomes a place where support and opposition gather.
visual: <svg viewBox="0 0 200 120"><g transform="translate(100,60)"><line x1="0" y1="20" x2="-60" y2="-10" stroke="#ccc" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="0" y1="20" x2="60" y2="-10" stroke="#ccc" stroke-width="2"/><circle cx="0" cy="20" r="15" fill="#3f88c5" opacity="0.3"/><circle cx="-60" cy="-10" r="16" fill="#F49D37" stroke="white" stroke-width="2" filter="url(#shadow)"/><circle cx="60" cy="-10" r="16" fill="#F49D37" stroke="white" stroke-width="2" filter="url(#shadow)"/></g></svg>

title: Arguments For and Against
text: Arguments explain why users support (INFAVOR) or oppose (AGAINST) a position. They are the reasoning that fuels the debate.
visual: <svg viewBox="0 0 200 120"><g transform="translate(100,50)"><line x1="0" y1="-20" x2="-50" y2="30" stroke="#ccc" stroke-width="1.5"/><line x1="0" y1="-20" x2="50" y2="30" stroke="#ccc" stroke-width="1.5"/><circle cx="0" cy="-20" r="15" fill="#F49D37" opacity="0.5"/><circle cx="-50" cy="30" r="14" fill="#00cc66" stroke="white" stroke-width="2" filter="url(#shadow)"/><circle cx="50" cy="30" r="14" fill="#db3a34" stroke="white" stroke-width="2" filter="url(#shadow)"/><path d="M-50 25 V35 M-55 30 H-45" stroke="white" stroke-width="2" /><path d="M45 30 H55" stroke="white" stroke-width="2" /></g></svg>

title: Thematic Areas (Clusters)
text: Clusters are created by AI: it reads argument texts and groups semantically similar ones. Color shows the balanceâ€”green if more pro, grey if balanced, red if more con.
visual: <svg viewBox="0 0 200 120"><g transform="translate(100,60)"><path d="M-40,-20 Q0,-45 40,-20 T40,20 T-40,20 T-40,-20" fill="#e2e8f0" stroke="#94a3b8" stroke-width="2" stroke-linejoin="round" /><circle cx="-25" cy="0" r="10" fill="#00cc66" stroke="white"/><circle cx="25" cy="5" r="10" fill="#00cc66" stroke="white"/><circle cx="0" cy="-15" r="8" fill="#00cc66" stroke="white"/><path d="M30,30 L40,50 L45,45 L55,55" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2" fill="none"/><circle cx="30" cy="30" r="3" fill="#333"/></g></svg>

title: Keywords
text: Keywords are extracted by AI from arguments. Shared keywords act as semantic bridges, linking related arguments across different positions or clusters.
visual: <svg viewBox="0 0 200 120"><g transform="translate(100,60)"><line x1="-50" y1="0" x2="0" y2="0" stroke="#ccc" stroke-dasharray="4"/><line x1="50" y1="0" x2="0" y2="0" stroke="#ccc" stroke-dasharray="4"/><circle cx="-50" cy="0" r="12" fill="#00cc66" opacity="0.4"/><circle cx="50" cy="0" r="12" fill="#db3a34" opacity="0.4"/><path d="M0 -18 L18 0 L0 18 L-18 0 Z" fill="#b38cb4" stroke="white" stroke-width="2" filter="url(#shadow)"/></g></svg>

title: What does the size of the nodes indicate?
text: Node size reflects its number of connections (degree). Larger nodes connect more elements and often play a more central role.
visual: <svg viewBox="0 0 200 120"><g transform="translate(60,60)"><circle cx="0" cy="0" r="10" fill="#F49D37" stroke="white" stroke-width="2"/><text x="0" y="25" font-size="10" text-anchor="middle" fill="#666">Low Degree</text></g><g transform="translate(140,60)"><circle cx="0" cy="0" r="30" fill="#F49D37" stroke="white" stroke-width="2" filter="url(#shadow)"/><text x="0" y="45" font-size="10" text-anchor="middle" fill="#666">High Degree</text></g></svg>

title: Now you can explore freely
text: Click nodes to read content, follow links to see relationships, and watch how the debate structure emerges as you explore.
visual: <svg viewBox="0 0 200 120"><g transform="translate(100,60)"><circle cx="0" cy="0" r="15" fill="#3f88c5" /><circle cx="-40" cy="-20" r="10" fill="#F49D37" /><circle cx="40" cy="-20" r="10" fill="#F49D37" /><circle cx="-40" cy="20" r="8" fill="#00cc66" /><circle cx="40" cy="20" r="8" fill="#db3a34" /><path d="M-10,35 L10,35 L0,45 Z" fill="#333"><animateTransform attributeName="transform" type="translate" values="0,0; 0,5; 0,0" dur="1.5s" repeatCount="indefinite"/></path></g></svg>
